Class ChangeMaker

java.lang.Object
  ChangeMaker

public class ChangeMaker
extends java.lang.Object

ChangeMaker takes in an amount of money compared to a purchase price and returns the amount of change, making sure the user has payed for all the goods and providing opportunities to terminate the transaction.

Version:
9.18.19
Author:
Arnav Dani

calcChange

public void calcChange(int price,
                       int payed)
Calculates, coins, and prints change.

Parameters:
price - price required in cents
payed - amount payed in cents

doOneTransaction

public void doOneTransaction()
Does a complete transaction for 1 customer while allowing exit of transaction.

getPayment

public int getPayment(int price)
Prompts user and get the amount payed. If amount is 0, method aborts. If amount is too less, user is prompted again. If user enters negative number or 0 method is terminated. When the amount is >= price, amt is returned.

Parameters:
price - needed to be payed in cents
Returns:
total amount payed in cents

getPrice

public int getPrice()
Prompts and gets price of goods from user using Scanner. If price is 0, is terminates.

Returns:
price in cents

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Runs the whole thing.

Parameters:
args - information from the command line

transact

public void transact()
Handles transactions for all customers with way to terminate using boolean.
